angularls spawing errors on non angular-project

Solution:
Updating path resolution to internal servers (e.g., Mason)

comment_data.body:
> on Windows, and it breaks the configuration there. It happens because, on Windows, ngserver is wrapped on a `.cmd` file, which is not in the expected directory

Does this solve that issue?


```suggestion
  local internal_servers = fn.globpath(fn.stdpath('data'), '**/node_modules/.bin/ngserver{,.cmd}', true, true)
```

comment_data.body: The glob itself works both on Windows and Linux to find the executable path. But it's costly! I'm working on a solution that use different strategies for each OS, but using only the `vim.fn.exepath` function to speed up the process. For the sake of completion, I'm testing it both on Windows and Linux. I will open a new PR soon!

comment_regular_data.body: It looks like the errors was spawned because it fails to find the @angular/language-server installed by Mason. I guess its the same with others.

Sorry for the forced-pushes, I used the wrong git config.

As mentioned in the issue #4175, I do have a quick question about the use of `config.root` here:

https://github.com/neovim/nvim-lspconfig/blob/c8503e63c6afab3ed34b49865a4a4edbb1ebf4a8/lsp/angularls.lua#L69

Shouldn't that be `config.root_dir` ?

> Sorry for the forced-pushes, I used the wrong git config.
> 
> As mentioned in the issue #4175, I do have a quick question about the use of `config.root` here:
> 
> https://github.com/neovim/nvim-lspconfig/blob/c8503e63c6afab3ed34b49865a4a4edbb1ebf4a8/lsp/angularls.lua#L69
> 
> Shouldn't that be `config.root_dir` ?

I'm not an expert, but it seems like it. In a monorepo the current code fails for me because it defaults to cwd. Changing it to root_dir makes it properly use the lsp root instead.

> @DocAmaroo, you are right, the field should be `root_dir`, not `root`. Relevant [documentation](https://neovim.io/doc/user/lsp.html#vim.lsp.ClientConfig) excerpt:
> 
> > {root_dir}? (string) Directory where the LSP server will base its workspaceFolders, rootUri, and rootPath on initialization.
> 
> About the correct path for the node_modules dir: I needed it to work on my Windows machine (were I first developed the config), but now I tested on a Linux workstation and also got the error you mentioned. I will check your solution on Windows and report back.

Should I make that change here, or in a separate PR, since it doesnâ€™t affect the issue this one was opened for?

Just checked the code on Windows, and it breaks the configuration there. It happens because, on Windows, ngserver is wrapped on a `.cmd` file, which is not in the expected directory, i.e., if we go up three levels with `../../..`, we won't end up in a node_modules folder.

It does fix the problem on Linux (which has a symbolic link to the original executable that is correctly recovered by Neovim's helper functions).

I'm thinking on reviewing this and the problems mentioned on #4083. I believe we can branch the `collect_node_modules` to use the glob with the original path resolution on Windows and keep your solution on the previous block of code, which recovers the `node_module` related to the `ngserver` executable.

Oh okay, thanks for the review then. If I have time, I may try to install it on Windows too and try things.

For the meantime, I will open a new PR for the `config.root_dir` to split this up
I opened a new PR (#4190) which uses a new strategy to find the `ngserver` `node_modules` folder. With it, @DocAmaroo solution works both on Windows and Linux.
